intro: Drimys brasiliensis var. ptaritepuiensis, commonly known as the Piará mountain pepper, is a shrub or small tree native to the tepuis of southern Venezuela and northern Brazil. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels and cinnamon trees. The plant is characterized by its aromatic, dark green leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruits are small, round berries that turn dark purple when mature. This species is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of the tepui plateaus, including high altitudes and nutrient-poor soils.
